intro: Polygonella croomii, commonly known as the Croom's sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and other grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
